Key Arguments: The justification for the legislation is weak and unsubstantiated.
The proposed legislation is an overreach and threatens free speech.
The government and mainstream media are exempt from the legislation, creating a double standard.
The bill gives excessive power to unelected bureaucrats without sufficient accountability.
The definition of 'harm' is vague and could be weaponized to suppress legitimate speech.
The penalties for non-compliance are excessive and could chill free speech.
Notable Quotes: The Bill is inconsistent with fundamental freedoms of speech and communication under International human rights instruments.
The Bill is a significant overreach by the Government.
The exclusion of government-authorised content from this censorship regime is hypocritical and inconsistent.
The Bill will give the Australian government the power to silence religious and political speech that contradicts prevailing ideologies.
